greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that prime(n)*2^k-1 is prime, or -1 if no such k exists.
comment: Primes p such that p*2^k-1 is composite for all k are called Riesel numbers. The smallest known Riesel number is the prime 509203. Currently, 2293 is the smallest prime whose status is unknown. For a(120), which corresponds to the prime 659, Dave Linton found the least k is 800516. - _T. D. Noe_, Aug 04 2005
mathematica: Table[p=Prime[n]; k=0; While[ !PrimeQ[ -1+p*2^k], k++ ]; k, {n, 119}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Aug 04 2005 )
xref: Cf. A046069 (least k such that (2n-1)*2^k-1 is prime).
results.author: _Pierre CAMI_, Jan 21 2005
ext: Corrected and extended by _T. D. Noe_, Aug 04 2005
